concept.title: Intra-cluster replication
concept.shortdesc: Intra-cluster replication involves replicas that are placed on another node in the same cluster.

section.title: Replicas
section.p: Replicas are copies of data that are placed on another node in a cluster. The source of the replicated vBucket data is called the master vBucket. Master vBuckets perform read and write operations. The destination vBucket is called the replica vBucket. Replica vBuckets receive a continuous stream of mutations from the master vBucket through the Database Change Protocol (DCP).

Within the data service, master vBuckets are spread across the cluster for even distribution of data and best performance. Additional replicas are optional. As an administrator, you can create between one and three additional copies (replica vBuckets) of the master vBuckets. Replica vBuckets are also spread across the cluster for best availability and can use failure domain definitions to guide distribution. For example, to protect against the node failure domain, Couchbase Server places a master vBucket and its corresponding replica vBucket on separate nodes or separate racks. Couchbase Server replicas
